articles.headline: Yellen Aims to Win Support for Global Tax Deal
articles.snippet: The Biden administration is trying to persuade other nations to approve a global minimum tax as it works to curb profit shifting and raise corporate taxes in the United States.
articles.abstract: The Biden administration is trying to persuade other nations to approve a global minimum tax as it works to curb profit shifting and raise corporate taxes in the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen will try to secure international support this week for a broad agreement that aims to put an end to global tax havens when she makes her first trip as President Biden’s top economic diplomat to the Group of 7 finance ministers summit in Britain.
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport and Liz Alderman

articles.headline: Netanyahu Rivals Agree on Israeli Coalition to Oust Him
articles.snippet: Benjamin Netanyahu, Israel’s longest-serving leader, is on the verge of losing power as his opponents strike a deal that would replace him with an ultranationalist, Naftali Bennett.
articles.abstract: Benjamin Netanyahu, Israel’s longest-serving leader, is on the verge of losing power as his opponents strike a deal that would replace him with an ultranationalist, Naftali Bennett.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Israeli opposition parties announced on Wednesday that they had reached a coalition agreement to form a government and oust Benjamin Netanyahu, the longest-serving prime minister in Israeli history and a dominant figure who has pushed his nation’s politics to the right.

articles.headline: When the Gunman’s Motive Remains a Mystery: Does It Matter?
articles.snippet: Even when they try to explain themselves, perpetrators are unlikely to help make sense out of the senseless.
articles.abstract: Even when they try to explain themselves, perpetrators are unlikely to help make sense out of the senseless.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two months after 10 people were killed in a mass shooting at a King Soopers in Boulder, Colo., investigators have still not said why the gunman chose that particular supermarket — or why he turned violent in the first place.

articles.headline: Wage Growth Is Holding Up in Aftermath of the Economic Crash
articles.snippet: The pay increases are giving Democrats a bragging point. But it comes with risks: Gains could fade, or spark quicker price inflation.
articles.abstract: The pay increases are giving Democrats a bragging point. But it comes with risks: Gains could fade, or spark quicker price inflation.
articles.lead_paragraph: When millions of workers were getting layoff notices last spring, Sharon McCown got something different: a raise.
articles.byline: By Ben Casselman and Jeanna Smialek

articles.headline: India and Israel Inflame Facebook’s Fights With Its Own Employees
articles.snippet: The social network wrongly bowed to government demands to take down content in the countries, employees said, in more signs of internal dissent.
articles.abstract: The social network wrongly bowed to government demands to take down content in the countries, employees said, in more signs of internal dissent.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When India’s government ordered Facebook and other tech companies to take down posts critical of its handling of the coronavirus pandemic in April, the social network complied on some posts.
articles.byline: By Sheera Frenkel and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: Tasked to Fight Climate Change, a Secretive U.N. Agency Does the Opposite
articles.snippet: Behind closed doors, shipbuilders and miners can speak on behalf of governments while regulating an industry that pollutes as much as all of America’s coal plants.
articles.abstract: Behind closed doors, shipbuilders and miners can speak on behalf of governments while regulating an industry that pollutes as much as all of America’s coal plants.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — During a contentious meeting over proposed climate regulations last fall, a Saudi diplomat to the obscure but powerful International Maritime Organization switched on his microphone to make an angry complaint: One of his colleagues was revealing the proceedings on Twitter as they happened.
articles.byline: By Matt Apuzzo and Sarah Hurtes
